citation.article-title: Methanocorpusculaceae fam. nov., represented by Methanocorpusculum parvum, Methanocorpusculum sinense spec. nov. and Methanocorpusculum bavaricum spec. nov.

p.s: Description of Methanocorpusculum bavarieum sp. nov.
Methanocorpusculum bavarieum (M.L. gen. n. ba.va'ri.cum to indicate the country of the original habitat of the type strain of the species)
Small, irregular coccoid cells usually occurring singly, < 1 μm in diameter.
Cell envelope consists of a hexagonally arranged S-layer with a center-to-center spacing of the subunits of 16.0 nm.
Glycoprotein subunits with an apparent molecular weight of 94000 are found.
Methane is produced from H2/CO2, formate, 2-propanol/CO2 and 2-butanol/CO2.
No growth and methane production observed on acetate, methylamines, methanol, ethanol, 1-propanol, 1-butanol and cyclohexanol.
Optimal growth temperature 37°C, no growth at or below 15°C and at or above 45°C.
Clarified tureen fluid obligately required for growth.
The G + C content of the DNA is 47.7 mol% (Tm) and 51 mol% (HPLC).
Isolated from anaerobic sediment of a wastewater treatment pond of the sugar factory in Regensburg (FRG).
The type strain of Methanocorpusculum bavaricum spec. nov. is strain SZSXXZ (DSM 4179).
